title: Sri Lanka issues Rs20 commemorative coin
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s central bank said it has issued a 20 rupee coin commemorating the 150th anniversary of the Faculty of Medicine at the University of Colombo.
The faculty was set up by British Colonial administrators in 1870.

The 2020 dated coin is nickel plated steel. It is seven lobed and has a plain edge. The Rs20 coin is 2 millimeters thick and has a diameter of 28 millimeters. A total of 500,000 coins had been minted.
The first coin was presented to President Gotabaya Rajapksa by Central Bank Governor Nivard Cabraal and Chandrika N Wijeyaratne, Chancellor of the University of Colombo.
